dialogues.text: It's going to take time. They need to open up a new route, they need to find political help. Maybe the Americans. Two weeks... maybe three. Rachel reacts with dismay. Rachel moves after David towar the living room. The camera continues after her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We work four shifts guarding him. We feed him at the end of each shift. We never leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (turns to Rachel, hard) And you're compromised. You don't leave the fucking house.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We can do this. We just need to stay focussed. The three turn to stare at something off-screen. The camera continues into the room to find Vogel's body slumped on the floor, bound to the radiator, mouth taped, slumped, unconscious. We continue towards him...closing on his face...CLOSER...Then his eyes open and he looks at us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's EYES OPEN and she lies in bed listening to the muffled sound of Vogel CURSING and YELLING in German next door - a breakfast ritual that has been going on for days

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: (In German) wees Fucking assholes! Fucking pig shit food! Fuck you! Fuck  133 133 134 134 you! Fuck... David and Stephan are wrestling with an enraged Vogel, trying to feed him. A BOWL clatters to the floor. Vogel's shouts are muffled his mouth is taped again. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 57.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: He continues to swear at his captors as best he can throu his gag. Rachel tries to block out the sound with her blanket.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Rachel walks in and finds a flushed David wiping oatmeal off his trousers, the empty bowl on the bench beside him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (Off her look) At this rate he's going to starve himself to death before we can get him back.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Rachel sits in the armchair near the end of her shift, watching Vogel who is slumped asleep. He looks dishevelle the oatmeal he refused to eat smeared down his chin. She can't delay the moment anymore. She takes a bowl of prepared oatmeal from the table besid her and walks towards Vogel, stirring the bowl with an unsteady hand. She kneels down in front of him. In the silence, we hear rain falling heavily outside. Vogel wakes, stays slumped, staring at her with dull eyes She takes the napkin that was covering the bowl and wipes the food from his chin. Finally she removes the tape from his mouth. Vogel watches her without moving. She offers h a spoon of oatmeal, waiting for the sudden yelling and abuse. He says nothing, just opens his mouth obediently.  135 135 Rachel feeds him a spoonful of oatmeal. He speaks to Rach in German, subtitled.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: My wife. Rachel ignores him, feeds him another spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is she hurt? Another spoonful, and another. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 58.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is she alright? An ALARM CLOCK on the table, rings - the end of her shift She wipes his mouth, tears some tape from the roll. Vogel closes his eyes, a look of such genuine suffering it stop Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please? Tell me she's alright. Rachel puts the tape over his mouth and stands. David wal in and takes his place in the ARMCHAIR facing Vogel. Rachel begins to leave. She looks back at Vogel who is staring after her, eyes pleading. She hesitates then give a small nod and turns to walk out of the room, passing Stephan who has been standing in the doorway, watching he

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Rachel starts to wash the oatmeal bowl. Stephan follows h in.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: You can't talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I didn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: You can't listen to him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know. I just...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: 136 136 137 137 138 138 (overlapping) I'm not angry -вЂ” He rubs her back. Rachel stiffens a little.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: - I'm just telling you - we don't talk to him. We don't listen to him. He isn't there. He isn't a human being. He... He stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have a date. Ten days time. The Americans are going to help. Rachel looks at him, relieved. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 59.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good. He smiles, stares at her, moves a little closer but Rache has already side-stepped him and walked away.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Stephan sits on the armchair in front of Vogel, taking th GUN apart, cleaning it.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Vogel thrashes around on the floor as best he can, David holding him down. Stephan tries to force oatmeal into him He spits it back out.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Rachel is cleaning, trying to keep busy, trying to keep t encroaching decay of the kitchen at bay, scrubbing and  139 139 140 140 141 141 142 142 143 143 144 144 scrubbing.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: An exhausted David, finishing his shift, walks out of the living room as Stephan walks out of his bedroom to take h place. Rachel walks out of the bathroom and into her bedroom, fo a moment the three criss-crossing each other's paths. Rachel's bedroom door closes. Both men avoid looking at each other as they pass it.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Stephan and David are carrying a struggling, cursing Voge towards the bathroom. Before they can get there Vogel pisses himself, the urine puddling on the floor at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Fuck! Stephan drops Vogel in disgust jumping back out of the wa Vogel lies in the pool, staring up at him, eyes triumphan FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogel leans against the wall, staring blankly at the window, sunk into a profound depression. He looks filthy, jaw dark with beard growth. Rachel watches him from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Rachel is washing Vogel's face with a towel. He pays no attention, continuing to stare out of the window. Rachel picks up a bowl of shaving cream, strips the tape off VOGEL's mouth, and begins to brush the cream over his face. She produces a RAZOR and carefully begins to shave his cheeks. She stops suddenly, a TEAR is running down Vogel's cheek cutting a line through the soap. He turns his eyes to her

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: Why don't you just kill me now? Rachel pauses for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How can you keep me waiting to die like this! Rachel keeps on shaving.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: I know what you want. You want to hand me over to the others, let there be some fucking sham of a trial. Then, when they kill me, you can tell yourself that there was no blood on your hands. Rachel switches to the other cheek. Vogel's getting more animated, tears in his eyes, a kind of bizarre indignation...

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that isn't true. There will be blood on your hands. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will be my murderer! You fucking hypocrite. You fucking... Rachel tilts his chin up a little and puts the razor to h throat. He falls silent, tenses, waiting. Then...

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Softly) Yes. Do it. You want to do it...  145 145 146 146 Rachel finishes with a trembling hand. Vogel slumps back against the wall, the tension in his bo easing away. He gives her a long, calculating look. And as we watch some CHANGE seems to come over him, some new fire beginning to kindle in him - a sense of cold contempt for Rachel and with it, perhaps, a fresh determination to survive this.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right. I'd forgotten. You Jews never knew how to kill. Only how to die. Rachel wipes the razor clean on the towel, SLAPS fresh ta onto Vogel's mouth and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is cleaning the kitchen again, clearing some of th mess of dishes into the sink. She moves a dirty pan which has been left overnight and stops, staring at the COCKROACH which is crawling inside. A sudden wave of NAUSEA hits her.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Rachel crouches at the toilet, vomiting. She finishes, rinses her mouth, looks at her pale reflection. She opens the door and steps out... Vogel stands DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HER. Rachel stands frozen - a split second of total panic. Then Stephan steps into sight behind Vogel, gun in hand - the morning bathroom visit. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 62. Rachel flattens herself against the hall wall, quickly wiping her mouth dry, as Stephan pushes Vogel past her towards the bathroom.  147 147 148 148

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephan is walking back home. A POLICE CAR SIREN somewhere nearby and Stephan hurriedly cuts into waiting in the shadows until the siren has faded he hurries on his way.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Rachel uncovers the dish of prepared oatmeal and down beside a sleeping Vogel. She removes the tape. Vogel wakes, breathes out her. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: I was dreaming about my wife. She feeds him some more.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One of the great regrets of my life is that we were unable to have children. My wife would have made a wonderful mother. wails an alley, away. Then kneels watches Vogel watches her, then suddenly SPEAKS IN ENGLISH...

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a great blessing. Rachel stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should try lemons. For the morning sickness. Rachel can't move.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They say it helps. Rachel struggles to hold it together, feeds him another spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's your name? (Beat) Sarah? Hannah?...Rachel? Esther? (Beat You Jews stay close to your  149 149 roots, don't you? It's a good thing. Very good. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 63. Rachel spoons in another mouthful.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I loved the bible as a child. Retribution. Higher justice. Rachel shovels in another mouthful. He chews it thoughtfully, examines her face.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes. I understand you perfectly. (Beat) You weren't lying at the clinic when you told me about your mother were you? About her death? Rachel loads the spoon with more oatmeal, determined not show any emotion.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry for your loss. It almost takes her breath away. She tears the tape and puts it over his mouth, gets up and walks away, determine not to show him any emotion. Vogel watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Rachel makes it out into the hallway before she feels the tears running down her face. She gives in to them, turns and finds David behind her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What happened? What's the matter? She can't speak at first.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Nothing. He...nothing. She wipes her face.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He can understand us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He can understand every word we're saying. He just spoke to me. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 64. Her face contorts as she tries to compose herself. David reaches out to hold her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's alright. It's alright. It's nearly over. He pulls her close, holds her, rests his forehead against hers. They stand like that, eyes closed. The moment hangs

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Suddenly) Why didn't you go? At the station. You could have got away. Why didn't you? She looks up at him. He stares into her eyes. Beat. Then, suddenly he kisses her. It's what she's waited so long fo and she's stunned for a moment, then puts her arms around his neck, returning the kiss hungrily. They are helpless with desire for one another. There is a sudden scratch of a key at the front door and, instinctively, the two break apart. Stephan enters, hair wet from the rain. He stops, seeing them, sensing the atmosphere. They stare back at him. Rachel steps away a little, wiping her face.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did they say? Stephan stares at them in silence. He unbuttons his coat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Stephan?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: It's not happening. They stare at him aghast - this is the last thing they wanted to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: The Americans have pulled out. (To Rachel) Has he been fed?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So...so what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh God... FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 65.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Did you feed him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What does that mean? What's the plan now?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (rising panic) We just need to get him to the airfield, there must be some other way, some... Stephan starts down the hallway towards her, angry.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: I said has he...? David instinctively steps in front of Rachel, raises a hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I'm asking you...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I'm talking to her! Supposedly it's her shift now, but instead of doing what she's supposed to be doing she's out here with you! (To Rachel) Now answer the fucking question: Did you feed him?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: YES! I fed him!  Stephan stands glaring at her, then turns abruptly away.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (Beat) There's no plan. There's no fucking plan. They said the operation is being "re- evaluated." He turns to David.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: You know what that means? They're going to cut us loose. They stare at him shocked. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 66.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: It's a fucking mess and they're backing away from it quickly as they can.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: It's happening. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They can't just leave us!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Yes they can! Because we fucked it all up! We fucked it all up and now we're on our own! Suddenly we hear someone KNOCKING on the front door. The three FREEZE, staring at each other. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Were you followed? Stephan stares at the door, thrown.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could you have been..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another KNOCK at the door. Stephan turns to the chest of drawers and takes out the GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephan? Stephan is hurriedly screwing the SILENCER onto the GUN. There's another KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stephan! Stephan walks into the living room and aims the gun at Vogel. Vogel instinctively squirms away, falling to one side, wriggling back as far as he can.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: If it's them, he dies. Vogel lies, breathing hard through his nose, eyes on the gun aimed at him. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 67. David suddenly steps in between the two, the gun now pointing at his chest.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You're not doing this.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: He's not getting away from me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: This isn't the mission.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: I decide what the mission is! If I say he dies, he dies.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're finishing this mission. We're taking him back.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Get out of the way! There is another KNOCK at the door. David and Stephan sta at each other, the tension building. Abruptly Rachel turn and walks down the hallway towards the door. Stephan cal after her.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Rachel. Rachel! From the hallway we hear the sound of the door being open - the murmur of conversation. The two men stand frozen, listening. Vogel lies, breathin hard through his nose. We hear the door close. The three listen as footsteps approach down the hall... Rachel walks back in. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Dully) It was the lady from the bottom apartment. She invited us to her New Year's Eve party. She turns and walks back out. The others stay where they are, frozen. We hear a PIANO PLAYING as we...

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: 150 As the piano music plays we see David and Stephan practis krav magah moves - careful, controlled, but under it all edge of real tension between them.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: 151 Vogel is tied in his usual place. Stephan sits ina dangerous mood. He's playing the piano. A lyrical renderi of Deutschland Uber Alles. Vogel is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: 152 As the music continues the two men's workout grows more intense - the punches and blocks build in speed, faster a  153 153 154 154 155 155 156 156 faster, both men breathing hard with the exertion, neithe willing to stop, a real violence simmering under the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephan knows he's watched and avoids Vogel's gaze until can stand it no longer and looks...

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: David is the first to break through the blocks - his fist stopping inches from Stephen's face. The two men freeze, staring at each other, breathing hard. The music crashes a halt.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Stephan is staring at Vogel. He begins to play the anthem more discordantly, hitting the keys more violently, as if the music is possessing him. Then suddenly he stops, stands up and walks away from the keyboard. Stares at Vogel. Vogel is very aware of the sudden change in atmosphere, a sense of impending violence. Stephan doesn't move. The moment hangs.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: David is taking over the shift from Stephan. They pass ea other in the doorway without a word. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 69. David stops, staring... Vogel lies in his usual place. A SACK has been placed ove his head, hooding him. The effect is deeply sinister.  157 157

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Stephan sits eating with Rachel. David walks in and throw the SACK on the table. Stephan glances at it, continues eating.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: It's your shift.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (To Rachel) Did you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (To Stephan) His mouth's taped. You want him to suffocate?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: I was sick of seeing his face. Go back in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Don't do that again. Stephan gets up and walks calmly towards David as if shooing him back out the room.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: You don't give orders David. It's your shift now so you can go back in there... He has his hands on David's chest, gently pushing him bac David takes his hold of the hands, pulling them free and suddenly there's a flurry of violent movement as Stephan yanks his arms free of David and the two men shove at eac other.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Stop it! They stop, breathing hard. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 70.  158 158 159 159

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're not animals. Just remember what we are. Remember what we're not. He walks back out. Stephan sits back at the table, starts eating again. He glances at Rachel, but she won't look at him. After a moment she gets up and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David looks up from his chair to see in the hallway. Something purposeful in her manner alerts him.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: David appears in time to see Rachel is putting on her overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Rachel doesn't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I have to get out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (Gently) Rachel... Rachel tries to unbolt the door. David bars her. Rachel tries to talk calmly but she's fighting panic.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Get out of my way, please. I'm just going to go out for a few minutes. That's all I want to do. Stephan walks out of the kitchen, taking in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She wants to go out.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (appealing) No one will see me. Tell him, David. I just want to walk. I just want to get some...air.  160 160 Please. Stephan shakes his head. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 71. Rachel tries to unlock the door, but David has hold of it She struggles against him.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. He takes her arm. Rachel jerks free.

dialogues.speaker: GET OFF ME
dialogues.text: Then she slumps against the door, her back to them. She's crying brokenly. A beat as the two men stand over her, not attempting to comfort her any further. Stephan turns and walks away. David leans his head against the door, waiting for her to stop. INT. SAFEHOUSE - LIVING ROOM. EVENING. It's raining heavily outside and water is dripping throug the cracks in the ceiling. David kneels next to VOGEL with a bowl of oatmeal and strips the tape from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: Thank you. David. David doesn't react. Vogel hums a tune to himself in between spoonfuls, watchi David, his mood strange.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David and Stephan and Rachel... He gives a soft laugh, finding something amusing in the sound of the names.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I had a choice I'd prefer  Rachel to feed me. So gentle...in another life, the makings of a Nurse, I think...in another life... David continues to feed, careful to appear immune to Voge

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How is she today? FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 72.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should let her get more rest. It's a dangerous time, the first month or two of the pregnancy. David stares at him, unable to hide his shock.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Beat) You didn't know? Vogel absorbs this thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not the father then? (Beat) I thought it would be you. I thought...I don't know. The way you look at her. The way she looks at you... David stirs the oatmeal, trying to think about what he's just discovered. Vogel doesn't take his eyes off him...

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Women can be like that, they like to make you dance first, I remember. (As though to himself) So, she chose the other one...? He shakes his head, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That must be hard, watching them together, right in front of you. And you not saying a word. Like the Poet says - "Great souls suffer in silence." I wouldn't have taken Stephan as a family man. Too ambitious, too...? Whereas you? David, I see you  with children...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (Quietly) Shut up. Vogel stares at him. This is the first time someone has spoken to him in weeks. He's quick to hide his sense of triumph.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: I am expressing my sympathy. For your suffering.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What does a monster like you know about suffering? FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 73.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: I'm a doctor, David. David stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: A doctor. (beat) You blind children trying to change the colour of their eyes. You inject people with petrol. You...you replace people's hands and legs and you watch as they... He stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isn't medicine. This is disease. This is sickness. Vogel seems to consider this.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: So we were all insane? Is that the answer?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (Beat) There's no answer. I'm not looking for an answer. I'm not looking for... He forces himself to be silent, tries to regain control o himself. He offers Vogel another spoonful, but his hand  trembles a little with the violence of his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: You're trembling. David pushes the spoon into Vogel's mouth, starts to load another spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's strange. Here I am - the victim, kidnapped, bound, soon to be murdered, but I think you are the one that is afraid, David. (Beat) Afraid of the monster. He leans closer to David.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Softly) Boo. They stare at each other, eye to eye. Vogel senses a new brittleness in David. His tone becomes more assured. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 74.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes. Do you know why it was easy to exterminate you people? Your weakness. I saw it. Every day I saw it. Every one of them, thinking only of how to avoid being flogged, or kicked, or killed. Only thinking of themselves. David looks up at him with a strange, crooked smile, eyes glittering.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do you think it only took four soldiers to lead a thousand people to the gas chambers? Entire families? Because not one, out of thousands, had the courage to resist, the courage to be the first to fall. Not one would sacrifice himself. Even when we took their children from them. I knew then that you people had no right to live, no right to... He may have begun his speech hoping to get a reaction fr David but he has lost himself in his rant and so rather than triumph we see only a moment of startled fear in his eyes as David suddenly swings the bowl violently at his head, SHATTERING IT on the pipe to which he is tied. He grabs Vogel by the collar and begins to punch him, har again and again. Vogel slides sideways, limp. And still David punches him a murderous rage, possessed, wanting to break his skull open, to kill him. Rachel and Stephan run in, with Rachel reaching him first She throws her arms around him, trying to stop him, but - instinctively - he throws a punch behind him. It connects splitting her lip and sending her flying to the ground. Stephan runs at him, knocking him to the floor, and remai lying on him, the two of them breathing hard, the assault finally over. VOGEL slumps forward, held up only by the rope at his wrists binding him to the pipe on the wall. Stephan is still struggling with David, who's panting, adrenalised, staring wildly at Vogel's slumped body.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Out. We're going out. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 75. He begins to drag him out. Stephan nods in the direction VOGEL.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) Are you going to be alright? Rachel nods. As she hears the door close, she turns to stare at Vogel. He's barely conscious, his face smeared with blood. 161 INT. SAFEHOUSE - BATHROOM. NIGHT. 161 Rachel drenches a cloth under the tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 162 Rachel cleans the blood from VOGEL's face. He has his eye closed.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: (Mumbling, in German) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tears off a new strip of tape and places it over VOGEL's mouth, gently. She notices the rain leaking in through the ceiling and walks off towards the kitchen. We hold on Vogel, apparent sleeping. Then his tied hand reaches out, straining and manages to reach one of the SHARDS of broken bowl.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: 163 Rachel gathers three METAL SAUCEPANS. She stops for a moment looking at FIREWORKS flashing in t sky. She remembers - it's New Years Eve. We TRACK with her as she walks into the living room and begins to place the pots on the floor to catch the rainwater which is dripping through various points in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL'S HANDS
dialogues.text: As he uses the shard to saw through his ropes. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 76.

dialogues.speaker: ON RACHEL
dialogues.text: ..as she finishes with the pots and notices the pieces of shattered bowl scattered around Vogel. She kneels down in front of him and collects up the pieces. She glances up a Vogel, checking him. He is still slumped, eyes closed. We TRACK with her as she walks back into the kitchen. Fro the living room comes the three distinct PINGS of rainwat dripping in the pots. She drops the pieces of bowl into the bin and stops, puzzled. It's a moment before she works out what she's noticed - something has changed in the sound of the rainwater next door. There only two drips instead of thr She walks back towards the living room... RACHEL'S P.O.V - through the living room door we can see that one of the pots has been overturned. Rachel slows to stop. A sudden wave of adrenalin causes her to turn but...it's too late. Vogel steps out of the alcove he's been standing in so that he is directly in front of her. Before she can even cry out he has slashed her face open with a SHARD OF GLASS. Instinctively she cups her hands to her ripped face. Voge grabs her by the hair and stepping behind her, tries to worm his other hand underneath her raised arms to reach h throat with the glass. Her training kicking in, Rachel uses a krav magah move to grab and twist Vogel's forearm, breaking his hold on her and turning the arm until, with a yell of pain, Vogel dro the shard. He swings wildly at her, but Rachel ducks the fist and drives the palm of her hand up into his face. Vogel stumbles back, surprised by her speed and the sudde pain of the blow. Rachel is about to press home the attack but is blinded b blood from her wound washing into her eyes. As she wipes her eyes clear, Vogel grabs a LAMP from a small chest of drawers in the hall and smashes it into he face. She falls. Vogel begins to run, but, driven by adrenaline and desperation, Rachel scrambles onto all fours and lunges a him, catching hold of his trouser leg as he moves towards the front door. Vogel stumbles, manages to pull a leg free and stamps dow on Rachel who lets go with a moan. He stamps again, steps free and kicks her hard in the head. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 77. Rachel rolls with the force of the kick and comes to a rest, losing consciousness. RACHEL'S P.O.V - LOW ANGLE - Fluttering in and out of darkness - Vogel's feet as he stands beside us, breathing hard. Then he turns and hurries to the front door...and out.  164 164 165 165 166 166 167 167 168 168 169 169 EXT. WALKWAY. BERLIN SAFE HOUSE - NIGHT. Vogel hurries along the walkway and sets off down the spiral staircase of the apartment building. INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT. Rachel lies motionless. We wait for her to cough as we sa her do before. But she doesn't. She just continues to lie still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below us Vogel clatters on down the stairs, flight after flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No movement from Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogel clears the stairs and bursts into the courtyard. There is a lurid flash of fireworks from nearby and for a moment we see Vogel lit, as he passes the point where earlier we saw him drop to the ground. He reaches the gate and goes through, his shadow disappearing on the pavement. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel holds a blood-soaked tea towel to her cheek, tryin to staunch the flow. David sits, staring ahead, in shock. Stephan bursts in, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Not a trace. Nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: He hurries to the drawers and takes out the gun, puts it into his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He might go to the house, might try and get a message to the wife...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (Without looking up) He's not going back to the house. He's gone. Fifteen years, it took them to find him. And he's gone. And no-one's going to find him again.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: So we what? We...are you going to make the phone call? Are you going to tell them how he got a fucking piece of broken bowl? Wonderful. But don't try and take me down with you. I've done nothing wrong. Remember that! Stephan kicks at the chair, at the drawers.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (muttering tensely) This can't happen! This is never going to go away.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I take responsibility. It was my shift.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (Quietly) This happened because of me. I let him go. And no-one's ever going to find him again. He closes his eyes, struggling with the enormity of his guilt. Stephan drops the gun onto the table, sits down. Outside hear more fireworks. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: No-one's ever going to find him  again. Something in his voice causes Rachel to look up at him.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Beat) What if he didn't escape? FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 79.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Only four people know what happened in this room. Us, and him. And he's not talking. No one will ever hear from him again.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Realizing what he means)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Nobody needs to know what happened here.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He escaped.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: That's the truth. But that doesn't have to be the truth we take home. The truth can be anything we want it to be. The truth is Vogel tried to escape, you struggled with him and got hurt. The truth is, seconds before he got away, Rachel got the gun and shot him. The truth is we got rid of him.... got rid of the body... got rid of every trace of the Surgeon of Birkenau.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We can't lie about this!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: No, you know what? We have to. We have to! This is...this isn't about us. This is about Israel. This is a national humiliation!  We can't be seen to fail. And in the end, Vogel rots away his life in some jungle, looking over his shoulder, waiting for the bullet...? Who's to say...? He looks at them both, trying to convince them, trying to convince himself.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe that's a worse fate. Maybe that's...The important thing is justice... justice is seen to be done! FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 80. Rachel turns to David, waiting, expecting him to say something. But David looks like he's been barely listenin lost in his own thoughts. He notices Rachel staring at hi

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He's gone. What does it matter? (Beat) He's gone. Stephan seizes on this, sensing he's close to convincing them.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (Seizing ) He's right. It makes no difference. No difference. All we have to agree is that we never talk about this. No matter what happens, we never tell anyone. The truth stays in this room. Between us. Agreed? Rachel looks at David again, wanting some kind of sign.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Rachel) Agreed? Say it. (Silence) I need to hear you say it! She's still staring at David. He's still avoiding her gaz

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Rachel) Say it. Say...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Agreed.  Silence. Rachel closes her eyes. Instead of relief she feels a kind of immense disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: David...?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Rachel? Say it. It's an oath. Say it. We CLOSE on Rachel. The moment that will change her life forever. From outside comes the sound of some REVELLERS on the street cheering, more fireworks. We hear some people chanting a countdown to the New Year...

dialogues.speaker: REVELLERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (From outside) ...vier, drei, zwei, ein! FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 81. But just before the expected barrage of fireworks we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 The young Mossad Agent stands smoking outside David's doo This is the scene we saw earlier. From within we can hear indistinct shouting. 171 INT. DAVID'S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS. 171 Rachel is holding the PRINTED SHEET - the point at which left this scene earlier.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (crying out) How could this happen? You said he would never speak! You said he'd never

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: We don't know it's him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh God! Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: If you read it...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He's alive! He's in the Ukraine! What else is there to read?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: This is a little internet story. (Grabbing the paper, reading) ..."a psychiatric patient claiming to be the Surgeon of Birkenau..." Some crazy old man. No-one is paying this any attention. Yet.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (as if her mind was elsewhere) How did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: David comes back after all this time, I want to know why. I had his apartment searched. This was on his computer... Rachel stares at him. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 81a

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He didn't say anything to you last night..? Rachel doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rachel. .?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No! Beat. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 82.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly) Why would he do this..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he couldn't handle it. I told him we had to deal with it and he couldn't handle it. He thought it was all going to come out and he panicked... He trails off, thinking about what happened down on the road. Rachel stares at him. His previous words have just sunk in.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Suddenly) Deal with it? (Beat) What does that mean? Deal with it? Stephan stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you tell him to do?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (Simply) I told him to find Vogel. I told him to finish it. Rachel stares at him. She stands up, starts to walk away comes back, slaps him hard across the face.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (quiet rage) Did you know he'd been ill? Did you...? You knew, didn't you? You killed him. YOU killed him! You knew he wasn't strong enough...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) FUCK DAVID! I don't want to hear about David! David took the coward's way out!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You could have left it alone! It's an old man in a hospital! You said - nobody will believe it! No-one will notice!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: There's a journalist. This stops her. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 83.  172 172

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A Ukrainian. He's heard about it and he's going to interview Vogel. (Beat) Then it all comes apart. (Beat) We don't have the name of the hospital. You have to find out where he is. Rachel stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: David's taken himself out of the equation. (Indicating his chair) I can't do it. You're the only one left.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Are you insane?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: We can't...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I'm not...Look at me! I'm not capable of...This is insane. I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (Beat. Simply) You have to, Rachel. Because for thirty years you've been taking the credit for it. (Beat, carefully) And there's Sarah. It's as if he's struck her. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I won't do this. She walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And into the stairwell. As before, the Mossad agent stand to let her pass, and watches as she sweeps down the stair  173 173 174 174

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene we saw earlier. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 84. Rachel is packing, folding clothes neatly, precisely, silently - but all the time there's a terrible tension about her movements. She tries to close a drawer but it sticks, She keeps trying, then in a sudden rush of fury yanks the drawer fr and hurls it across the room. She stands breathing hard. Then something we didn't see - her gaze settles on a photograph beside her table - SARAH holding her son, smiling at us. Rachel stares at the photograph, her breathing slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephan sits amongst the remains of a meal. Sarah and her husband are on the beach below, playing wit their son. Stephan watches them. He senses a presence and turns to find Rachel behind him. She sits down, stares down at the beach through her dark glasses. Stephan watches, almost holding his breath, working throu lightning calculations of how to handle her. But Rachel i the first to speak.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Beat) I always knew this would happen. I knew we'd be punished. I knew we'd have to pay.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (Quietly) I thought I'd already been punished.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: God doesn't plant car bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't referring to the wheelchair. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I could go back, Rachel, I'd change it all. If I could give you back a chance to be happy, to be... FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 85. He stops. She is staring back at him coldly, unmoved. He shrugs, letting that go.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But there's one thing I would never change. She looks over to where Sarah is playing with her son, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Instantly) She isn't going to find out. She shakes her head, as if the idea itself were impossibl

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She can never find out. Stephan stares at her, KNOWING THAT HE HAS HER, that it's already decided. He takes out the envelope and slides it across the table towards her. She examines the ticket and passports inside Then he slides her the BLACK CASE. We've seen this part o the scene before. She stares at it with disgust, knowing what it is. Then s takes it and puts it in her handbag.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: My car's waiting outside. It can take you to the airport. She stands up, an elegant woman at lunch, her dark glasse her suit... She looks down to Sarah, raises a hand in farewell. Sarah, not understanding, waves a hand in response, call something which is lost under the sound of the sea.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go down to her. Say goodbye to her. Rachel stands stock still, staring down at her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: How can I? (Beat.) How can I? She turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: 175 Sarah stands, shading her eyes, watching the small figure of her mother walking away from her.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 178 179 EXT. CITY CENTRE. KIEV. UKRAINE - DAY. 179 A tram wipes through the frame to reveal Rachel walking across a busy street towards the stark facade of an imposing 1960's building. A TITLE reads: Kiev, Ukraine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 180 The public area of the building - a main reception desk, little cafe, a sweeping staircase leading up to the floor above... Rachel is at the reception desk...

dialogues.speaker: 180A NEWSPAPER BUILDING
dialogues.text: Rachel crosses to a TABAC KIOSK, glancing back to some glass doors behind her. A sign indicates the offices of the UKRAINIAN EVENING NEW We can see a RECEPTIONIST at her desk. A young man walks through the entrance, and she throws a knowing glance up him as he passes. Rachel takes in the ALARM PAD beside the receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (turning to the Kiosk Owner) Cigarettes please.

dialogues.speaker: 180B
dialogues.text: Rachel sits, silhouetted against the large window. Rachel opens her pack and lights a cigarette. A WAITER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: (In Russian) What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Just a coffee. She stares out at the stream of people passing in and out of the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 181 Late sixties. Young Rachel, Stephan and David are giving talk to a group of young Israeli soldiers. This is a well rehearsed routine, something they have probably done many times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, I don't think I was thinking about myself at all. I was thinking about my mother. I was thinking about how she had suffered in Europe. The FACES of the soldiers, moved by this. One raises a hand.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: The same question to Mr. Peretz. The others look at David, waiting for him to make his usu response. But David doesn't move. Stephan looks along the row. David sits staring straight ahead. The silence GROWS. And we realize he's NOT GOING TO ANSWER. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 182 The house is cold, white, aggressively modern. Rachel sit in her underwear, drunk, a bottle and glass of wine on he dressing table. Stephan is dressing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (Calmly) Fuck him. He examines his reflection in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Fuck him. A DOORBELL rings downstairs. He walks out to answer it, taking the wine bottle from her as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hurry up. Rachel finishes her glass, starts to apply some eye makeu She senses something and turns to find YOUNG SARAH (four watching her from the doorway. She stares back at her dully.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Go to bed, Sarah.  183 183

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: A cocktail party in progress - Stephan is mingling with t guests - Mossad high-fliers, Military, politicians. She watches him handle them - just the right mix of deference and charm. Rachel stands against a wall, drunk, watching him as he laughs sycophantically at something one of the politician has said. He crosses over to an attractive BLONDE WOMAN and greets her. As Rachel watches he runs a hand down the woman's ba - an unmistakably INTIMATE gesture. Rachel watches - depressed by how little this makes her feel. She begins to mix herself another drink, sees someo across the room, and her face changes...

dialogues.speaker: ON DAVID
dialogues.text: He's standing alone drinking, nervous. Rachel appears beside him. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 89.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: My own party and you're the only * friend I have... * She turns, leans against the wall, scans the party, watch Stephan working the room. *

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... all Stephen's friends. * Stephen's girlfriends. She turns to see what David's reaction to this is, but he continues to watch Stephan. *

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what kind of a friend are you? I call you last night and...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought the silence was for the audience, I didn't know you'd really lost your voice. David suddenly takes her hand and pulls her round the corner.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: He turns to her, his face alive with an energy that we haven't seen before - fear or excitement?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why do you call me?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You call me, at night, when you're drunk. Why do you call me?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do you want us to fuck around behind his back? Like he fucks around behind yours? Is that what you want? Rachel stares at him, upset and angry.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I want a friend FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 89a

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't want to be your friend. (Beat) I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good. I don't know why you bothered coming if your just going to...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Come with me. She realises he isn't talking about the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: te Ok OR OE oF tO OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where...whare are you going?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. Away from Israel, away from this...poison. I can't stand what it is doing to us. Come with me. We'll go to Spain. Or Italy... We can save ourselves. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 90.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is such a beautiful photograph, Rachel. You look like a pair of Angels. A YOUNG ISRAELI and his WIFE are admiring a photograph th Wife has picked up from the table - a portrait of Rachel and Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Mouth dry) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (showing it to David) Isn't it lovely? David doesn't answer, is still staring at Rachel. The husband senses a scene, takes the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: (Smoothly) You know you have to excuse us (to his wife)... we must catch Michael... His wife is confused...

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (leading her away) ...before he leaves, you remember...? Rachel is staring at David, shaking her head, eyes glittering with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tb FF OF tO OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tO OF * te Ok OR OE *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me now. We had our chance. We said we would live with it. This is me living with it. tO Ok OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David takes her hands.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm in love with you, Rachel. I want my life back so I can live it with you. Come with me. + Oe

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You can start again. You don't have a child. You don't have anyone.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: + Oe

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I thought I did. (beat) Why can't we be happy? FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 91. tO OF

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (after a beat, quietly) Because we did a terrible thing.. He nods, finally, and lets go of her hand. Beat. Then he turns and walks away from her through the crowd to the door, and is gone. She moves to follow him, then stops. Rachel turns and finds STEPHAN standing against the wall waiting. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (flat)  184 185 185 There you are. He leads her back towards the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits, still smoking, though it's dark outside now. There is a sound of chatter from above her and she looks to see JOURNALISTS spilling out from the offices above, coming down the stairs towards her. Rachel eases a PHOTOCOPIED SHEET from her bag and examine it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photocopy of a JOURNALIST'S BY-LINE - a long, rather mournful face, the name YURI TITOV. She checks the face, slips the sheet back in the bag, loo up, studying the men descending towards her. Moments late she has found him - chatting to a colleague. He reaches the ground floor and walking past her, goes to the bar for a coffee. Rachel finds herself staring at him - the man WHO COULD DESTROY HER LIFE. Yuri seems to sense someone watching him and looks to whe Rachel was sitting. But there's no-one there. INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE LOBBY. CONTINUOUS. The PRETTY RECEPTIONIST stands chatting to her BOYFRIEND, young journalist. He is holding her coat for. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 92. She starts to put it on and the Boyfriend gives a brief bark and play-bites at her neck. She laughs, pushing him away. Rachel hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Russian) Am I late? I'm sorry.... Can I  186 186

dialogues.speaker: 186A
dialogues.text: 187 187 188 188 place an advertisement?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (gathering her things) 100 grivna for twenty words. 5 grivna a word after that. Rachel proffers an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here... The girl takes it.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Thanks. Rachel fishes in her bag and hands over a 100 GRIVNA NOTE

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: This should cover it. The girl drops the envelope onto her desk, and slips the money into a small DESKTOP DRAWER UNIT, as Rachel leaves. INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE - MEZZANINE LEVEL. CONTINUOUS. Rachel pauses outside the doors, zipping her bag, watchin the receptionist tap a code into the alarm key-pad before letting herself and the Boyfriend out. She locks the door after them and the two walk past Rachel who smiles a goodbye. She watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dark now, eerily lit by the street lights outside. An ELDERLY SECURITY GUARD trudges past, whistlin softly.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: 189 189 190 190 191 191 INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE - LOBBY. CONTINUOUS. We're looking through the glass doors to the shadowy mezzanine level beyond. A DARK FIGURE stands silhouetted the door. We hear the scrape of tools working on the lock There is a click, the doors open and Rachel slips inside. The alarm begins to BEEP. Rachel takes out a TORCH. A qui twist and the beam becomes ULTRAVIOLET. As Rachel moves swiftly towards the alarm box, the beam from the torch sweeps across the girl's desk, and we see Rachel's envelope glowing a deep PURPLE. We may also noti that the desktop drawer unit where the girl placed the money is smudged with purple FINGERPRINTS. Rachel opens the alarm box and shines her beam onto the keypad. We see four PURPLE FINGERPRINTS, one deeply pigmented, the other three progressively less so. Rachel takes a deep breath and punches the four marked ke in what she hopes is the correct order. The alarm falls silent. She moves quickly out of the lobby, down the corridor... INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE - MAIN ROOM. CONTINUOUS. ...and into the main press room. Using her torch on its regular setting, Rachel scours the desks for information. On one desk is a photograph of the journalist we just met YURI - HOLDING A LARGE FISH in triumph. Rachel dives into the desk's FILING UNIT and begins to rifle through the files. Presently, she finds an OLD PICTURE OF VOGEL. He wears SS uniform, the same shot we have seen before. Behind it, a stack of SCRIBBLED NOTES. She begins to scan them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 192 192 193 193 194 194 The Receptionist and her drunk BOYFRIEND stand at the doo to the newspaper office, trying to open them. It takes th a moment, aS - unaware that it was unlocked - the girl ha accidentally locked it. Her boyfriend tussles with her playfully, keen for her to let him try instead, but she swats him away, turns the key again and finally they're i FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 94. INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE - MAIN ROOM. NIGHT. Rachel, unaware, is still reading through the notes. She takes out paper and pen and copies down the information s needs. INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE - LOBBY. NIGHT. The receptionist stands by the alarm box, drunk and confused, as the Boyfriend, impatient and equally drunk comes up close behind her and reaches round to clumsily unbutton her coat.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (Whispering) That's weird. The coat undone, the Boyfriend reaches round and snakes h hands up inside her sweater. She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I set the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: The alarm's not on.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit? He moves his hands from her breasts to grab her around th waist and pull her away from the alarm box. INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE - MAIN ROOM. CONTINUOUS. Rachel is still at the desk reading. Suddenly the main LIGHTS are switched on and the Receptionist and the  Boyfriend stagger into sight. Rachel stands frozen, COMPLETELY VISIBLE. The girl and boyfriend stand kissing, too engrossed in ea other to see the woman standing only ten feet from them. The Receptionist pulls free, laughing, makes it back to t entrance and switches the lights off, plunging the room into darkness. Rachel moves behind a column. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 95. Laughing softly, the Boyfriend leads the girl over to a desk. He opens a drawer, searches through it, triumphantl produces a PETTY CASH TIN.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: The loot! He starts to take some cash from the box.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (Laughing) You can't!

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: I'll put in an i-o-u... He scribbles on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Andrei borrowed money to take Katia to Club Oxygen." He drops the note in the tin.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: You're going to get fired. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: You're worth it.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: You're going to get me fired!

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: (Kissing her) I'm worth it. They kiss again, slowly backing up against the desk Rach was searching. The two struggle with their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE COLUMN
dialogues.text: 195 Rachel has no way of reaching the door. She closes her eyes as the young couple begin to have sex on the desk. Then she opens her eyes and notices something... RACHEL'S P.O.V - CLOSE on her TORCH which is still on the desk. The Boyfriend seems to be staring RIGHT AT IT. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 96. Rachel watches, holding her breath.

dialogues.speaker: ON BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: ..asS we realise he is staring STRAIGHT THROUGH the torch lost in the moment. Next moment the couple change positions and some books an the torch are swept from the desk and clatter to the floo The TORCH ROLLS across the carpet to the shadowy entrance of the cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE COLUMN
dialogues.text: Rachel stares at the torch, wondering if she can reach it before they can see her. But at the moment the desktop tryst reaches its noisy conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DESK
dialogues.text: The Boyfriend does up his trousers and pulls on his coat. The Receptionist adjusts her dress. She notices the falle items and begins to pick them up, following the trail to the torch.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE COLUMN
dialogues.text: Rachel stands frozen as the Receptionist stoops down directly IN FRONT OF HER and picks up the torch. The Boyfriend notices.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I'm tidying up.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: Are you working? Are you at work now?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (Laughing) No, I'm not working.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: So leave them. She drops the objects and follows her Boyfriend out. 196 196 FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 97. Shaking, Rachel picks up her torch and replaces the items she is still holding from Yuri's file into the filing cabinet. From OS, we hear the BEEP BEEP BEEP of the alarm being reset. Rachel's heart sinks. OS, we hear office doors close, and the KEY TURNING in th lock. Rachel's eyes alight on A MOTION SENSOR, blinking in the corner of the room. She waits. And eventually - no choice - she runs for the door. The motion sensor lights up and the alarm strikes up loud with a warning BEEP-BEEP-BEEP. INT. NEWSPAPER OFFICE - LOBBY. CONTINUOUS. Frantic, Rachel dashes to the alarm box, the insistent be beep-beep even louder here. Rachel runs for the door, yan

dialogues.speaker: 196A
dialogues.text: 197 197 198 198 199 199 it open and bolts out. Moments later, the alarm CLANGS into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel bursts out of a fire exit, the siren blaring and disappears into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's car drives off down the road. INT. CAR. UKRAINIAN ROAD - NIGHT. Rachel has pulled over and is on her cell-phone to Stepha

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He's at the BABENKO Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephan is alone, working at his computer. He taps in the name, searches, clicks on the link to a map. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 98.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's outside Vinnycja. About a hundred and fifty miles south- west of you. What name is he going under? Rachel checks her notes.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ivan Schevchuk. He's the right age.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: When is he supposed to interview him?  200 200 201 201 202 202 203 203

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. There's silence from the other end. Both know what this means.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This will be over soon. And when it is... Rachel hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car drives through the wintry landscape.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HIRE CAR. ROAD
dialogues.text: A forest of fir trees pass as she drives. Rachel's mind i elsewhere. The car drifts to the wrong side, then swerves as she corrects.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What were you thinking at that moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night before David's suicide. FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.09 99. RACHEL is being interviewed by a FEMALE FACULTY MEMBER. Projected on a screen behind is an image of the young Rachel, Stephan and David. The audience consists of mainly female students, hands raised.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: 204 204 Did you think you were going to die? Rachel seems to consider this carefully, although we know by now that this is a question she's been asked thousands of times and has a carefully rehearsed answer to.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I'll tell you something. At that moment, when I was on the floor, I wasn't thinking about myself at all. I was thinking about my mother. And what she had suffered in Europe. I think that was what gave me the strength to get up again. The audience listen, moved. Rachel looks out and then FREEZES - Older David sits near the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: LECTURER
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure you'll all join me in thanking Ms Singer... As the audience applaud enthusiastically Rachel smiles, trying to regain her composure but her eyes are drawn bac to David, standing in the shadows, watching her intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is empty now, only David and Rachel sitting in the seats. David looks like a man who's been up on speed for too lon eyes strangely bright in his exhausted face. Neither of them seems to be able to bridge the divide

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You look well. Rachel ignores this. She's waiting for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Stephan know you're here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I expect so. (Beat) I read about him. How is he?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (shrugs) The same. Different. Resigned to life at a desk. He likes to play the tragic hero... She stops herself, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Things became...very bad between us. We try to stay civil for Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Have you met anyone else? Rachel stares at him. How can he even ask this?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. Thank you for asking. There was someone...but he left. And I never heard from him again. (beat, hard) What are you doing here, David?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I wrote you letters.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Pity you didn't send any of them

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Rachel...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (overlapping) What is it? Thirty years...? She's suddenly so angry, she starts to gather her things go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I wanted to see you... Hk Ok OF Hk kk OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (overlapping) All that time...Not a single word?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was ill for a while, Rachel. (A beat) I spent some time in... ina kind of hospital

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Mexico

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What were you doing in Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Different jobs. Some teaching. Whatever I could get.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I travelled a lot. The States. Most of South America. North Africa.... I kept moving (beat) Looking for him

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Who..? He doesn't answer and she looks up, suddenly realising wh he means. She feels a sudden, instinctive rush of fear.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why? (beat) What would you have done if you had found him..? tk FOF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok Ok OR OF OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tb Ok OR Oe + kOe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's watching her intently

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I would have told the truth. I would have gone to the newspaper, and said "this is the Surgeon of Birkenau." I could have finally seen him face trial. Rachel listens to this, mesmerised.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: And what would have happened to us?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We'd be free. Whatever happened to us, it seemed to me we'd be free. Rachel stares at him without answering

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Don't you agree? Aren't you tired of lying? Isn't that what you would have done - if you'd found him?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But it isn't just us. (Beat) It's Sarah... Beat. Something changes in David's face, something fading away. He sits slowly back

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She hasn't done anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (Quietly)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: If the truth had come out she would be destroyed. (Beat) So...no, I wouldn't have told the truth. (A long beat) But you never found him tk Ok Ok Oe * + kOe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hk OF ee te kOe  She looks at him, waiting for him to contradict this.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No I never did. The LECTURER appears at the doors to the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: LECTURER
dialogues.text: Ms Singer?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Relieved) Yes. Thank you... She stands up again, the spell is broken.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT 'D)
dialogues.text: There's a car for me.... (Putting on her coat) Did you hear about Sarah's book...? After a moment, David nods.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The launch is tomorrow. Perhaps you could come? I don't know if Stephan will be there or not but... tk Ok Ok Oe

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (suddenly) If we could go back... if I'd waited for you...if you'd come...would it have been different...? Hk kk OF FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS - 26.03.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We can't go back. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: 204A
dialogues.text: 205 205 206 206 207 207 Come tomorrow. We'll talk then? David gives a smile that might be an assent. Or might not Rachel nods, walks quickly out of the auditorium. David sits as the light banks above switch off one at a time, watches the line of shadow moving towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car roars past and is gone, revealing Rachel standing amongst the trees beside her car, a cigarette forgotten i her hand, absorbing what it was David was asking her. Finally she drops the cigarette and climbs back into her car.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ...driving, lost in thought. She drives into some grounds...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL'S P.O.V THROUGH WINDSCREEN
dialogues.text: The BABENKO HOSPITAL - a huge, imposing building stands i wintry grounds. A long drive leads up to the car park and the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. CAR
dialogues.text: Rachel stares up at the building as she drives towards it  208 208 INT. BABENKO HOSPITAL - RECEPTION. CONTINUOUS. The large lobby area, vast pillars. A few stairs lead up from this to a waiting area, separated from the corridors beyond by BARS AND LOCKED GATES. Rachel approaches a young male REGISTRAR at RECEPTION.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Russian) Good morning. I'm here to visit Mr. Schevchuk? The man squints at her, checks his register an squints at her again.

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRAR
dialogues.text: You're from the newspaper? Because I have a man's name here...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no. I'm Mr Schevchuk's niece. Anna Barova. I've been before, do you remember? A moment's scrutiny, then a shrug.

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRAR
dialogues.text: Well, our visiting hours haven't changed, I'm afraid. Eleven till one. He points to a PLAQUE that reads: VISITING HOURS: 11:00am - 1:00am, 5:00pm - 8:00pm Sarah glances at her watch. It's 10.25.

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take a seat? He points to a waiting area. Rachel walks up the few stairs past a large PILLAR and takes a seat, trying to think of her next step.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: She glances to her left, through the bars, and sees an OL WOMAN in a patient's gown staring blankly at her from the  209 209 210 210 far end of the corridor. A DOCTOR appears and leads the O Woman away, still staring. Rachel looks away, unnerved. Someone has just walked in and is talking to the Receptionist. Rachel's view is obscured by the pillar and she leans slightly to see who it is. RACHEL'S P.O.V - YURI stands showing his press card to th Registrar.

dialogues.speaker: AT RECEPTION
dialogues.text: The Registrar passes the press card back.

dialogues.speaker: REGISTRAR
dialogues.text: Mr. Schevchuk is in room 414, Visiting time starts at eleven o'clock. You can take a seat over there. Yuri walks across the lobby, towards where Rachel is waiting, but as he clears the pillar we see her seat is EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PILLAR
dialogues.text: ...Rachel waits for Yuri to pass and then slips back out the lobby. EXT. BABENKO HOSPITAL - CONTINUOUS. Rachel emerges - panicking. Time is almost up. What can s do?

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. CAR. REAR OF HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Rachel's car is speeding down a narrow road that runs behind the hospital. Two stone arches frame the road, whe the building meets the hillside. RACHEL'S P.O.V - high fences - the forbidding facade of t hospital - rows of barred windows. Rachel is scanning the building, looking for some way in.  211 211 212 212 213 213 214 214 215 215 216 216

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. CAR/REAR ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Suddenly we pass a central arched entrance. A man is opening large double METAL DOORS for A LAUNDRY VAN to lea the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: It takes Rachel a few moments to register it. Then she BRAKES .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAUNDRY VAN is driving through the doors. It stops, engine idling, and the DRIVER begins to climb down to clo the doors after him. Before he clears the side of the truck, Rachel slips into the darkness. The DRIVER, oblivious, reaches the doors and begins to swing them shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel runs up the staircase from the service area of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long and bleak with rows of BARRED DOORS. Rachel runs on. INT. WAITING AREA. BABENKO HOSPITAL -DAY. Yuri is writing in a notebook. The clock says: 10:50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches a junction - the vast, white corridors stretching away from her in different directions, like a nightmarish maze.  217 217 218 218 219 219 220 220 She stares about her, picks a corridor and begins to run again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches a MAP on the wall and scans it, franticall trying to locate the room she needs. She hurries on to an ancient looking ELEVATOR and gets in jabs at the fourth floor button. With a groan of its motor the elevator begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: RACHEL'S P.O.V - TRACKING past rows of NUMBERED DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: Finally we reach it - ROOM 414. Rachel stares at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel sits in a CUBICLE. She takes the BLACK CASE from h handbag and opens it. Inside is a pen. She lifts this and the false bottom of the case away to reveal a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE and an AMPULE of a clear liquid. With trembling hands she begins to prepare the injection. She can't quite believe what she is about to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel enters the room. The curtains are drawn and Rachel hesitates for a moment, her eyes adjusting to the gloom. A MAN sits in a chair, angled towards the window, his bac to us. An IV drip hangs on a stand, its tube running into cannula on the back of a withered hand which hangs from t chair. The only sound is the faint, rasping breath of the man.  221 221 222 222 Rachel moves a little closer. On the bottom of the bed hangs a medical chart. The name reads Ivan Schevchuk. Rachel moves closer, carefully taking the HYPODERMIC NEED from her pocket. INT. BABENKO HOSPITAL - RECEPTION. DAY. A NURSE is unlocking the gate at the waiting area for Yur He walks through them and over to the ELEVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel stands by the IV drip and tube. She can inject directly into the tube - and it will be over. She holds t tube, rests the tip of the needle against it. She struggl with herself. Just one tiny push... She can't do it. She stands frozen for a moment then slowly lowers the needle. Beside her, the steady breathing alters. The Man stirs an a cadaverous face half turns towards us.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: Rachel and Schevchuk stare at each other. The face is ancient, lined...but IT ISN'T THE FACE OF VOGEL.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN SCHEVCHUK
dialogues.text: (Weakly) Are you the journalist? (Beat) Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Beat, meaning it) No. No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN SCHEVCHUK
dialogues.text: My name is Dieter Vogel. I am the Surgeon of Birkenau. (Beat) Have you heard of me?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yes. I've heard of you. Schevchuk looks at his withered hands.  223 223 224 224 225 225

dialogues.speaker: IVAN SCHEVCHUK
dialogues.text: (Simply) I have killed thousands. You can take my photograph. The last photograph of the Surgeon of Birkenau? He struggles to raise his arm in the Nazi salute, a pathetic sick man. Rachel sits down at Schevchuk's desk, feeling suddenly exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri stands in the elevator waiting for the doors to clos

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Hold the doors please. Yuri holds the doors, as the Nurse approaches, escorting ELDERLY WOMAN with a walker - the two moving at a snails pace. Yuri watches, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CLOSE on Rachel, lost in thought. Beside her Schevchuk rambles on.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN SCHEVCHUK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ..-It comes down to blood. We weren't afraid of power. It was our destiny. The slave races had bred with apes. But we Aryans are descendants of the Theozoa who come from another planet. We were born to rule and to... He dissolves into a fit of weak coughing. Rachel stares at a NOTEPAD AND PEN on the desk beside her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
