dialogues.text: 226 226 227 227 228 228 Yuri walks towards Schevchuk's room. He pays no attention to Rachel as he passes her, sitting on a bench, dialling her cell phone. She listens to the other end ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephan is talking to a couple of OFFICIALS. His cell pho rings.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (Answering) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Beat) It isn't him. Stephan nods, a fixed smile on his face, covers the mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Officials) A family matter... Would you give me a moment? The two OFFICIALS leave the office, closing the door behi them. Stephan takes a a beat to calm his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Into phone) You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It isn't him. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank God. Thank God. This is wonderful. This is...and you're okay? Rachel? You're alright yes?  229 229 230 230 231 Rachel stares at the wall. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You were wrong.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, thank God I was, but...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: About David. You were wrong about him. ..smiling and gesturing "one minute" to the two officials on the other side of the glass partition.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: About David?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He didn't kill himself because he was afraid the story would come out. This gets Stephan's attention.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: When he came to see me, he was asking me for something.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: My permission. And I didn't give it. I wouldn't let him tell the truth and he was tired of living with the lie.

dialogues.speaker: 109A.
dialogues.text: 231 ...mind whirring. He can sense something.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Truth is a luxury, Rachel. Some people have to put other things first - their country, their people...their children...

dialogues.speaker: ON RACHEL
dialogues.text: 232 Struggling not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sarah's so proud of you, Rachel. You have to think about her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (Crying) I want her to be proud of me. Stephan is desperate to talk her down from the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Soothing) Of course you do.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I want to do something to make her proud of me.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN
dialogues.text: Rachel...? Rachel...?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: People have to know the truth, Stephan. David was right.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rachel, listen to me...! She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ON STEPHAN
dialogues.text: ...listening to the dial tone, panic overwhelming him. There's a knock at the door and an ASSISTANT appears.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Stephan doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: ON RACHEL
dialogues.text: She sits for a moment, then stands up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other end of the corridor, as the small figure o Rachel steps away from the bench. She straightens her sca and wipes her eyes, then begins to walk towards us.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: As she walks towards the end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: PULLING RACHEL
dialogues.text: As she moves down another corridor. She reaches an opening on her left, which reveals a STAIRCASE winding around a central lift shaft, caged in frosted glass panels.  239 239 240 240 She glances through it as she passes. And just for a second we see an ELDERLY MAN walking down the stairs. Rachel has walked on a few steps before it registers, and she stops - VOGEL. She walks back to the opening.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: The figure seems to have retraced their steps, because th are now walking FURTHER UP the staircase, on the other si of the lift shaft - a shadowy figure through the frosted glass which quickly disappears from sight. Rachel stares after him, frozen. What did she just see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to climb the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel comes through double doors and finds herself in a long REC ROOM - PATIENTS and some STAFF grouped around th room. Rachel begins to walk through the room - elderly men all around her, playing cards, reading, some sitting staring vacantly. She walks through them, staring at faces. Is he here? Is amongst this ordinary world? She feels her pace quicken as she's drawn on through the room. It's as if she's back at that terrible night. Vogel ahead of her somewhere, escaping all over again. She FLASHES through DOUBLE DOORS into a junction area - a long, empty corridor leading away from her on the right, ahead another set of double doors... She bursts through these doors and finds herself in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 241 A long, white tiled corridor of a room. A row of windows down the right, under which sit WASHBASINS. There's a row of LOCKERS and DOORS along the left. Rachel walks on, feeling increasingly as if she's ina dream. She's deep into the room before she realises it's a dead- end - there's no exit ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: (a dull rasp) Why did you come...? She turns and freezes. Vogel has emerged from one of the doorways on the left. N he's between her and the doors on the far side of the roo

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did you have to come? You didn't have to follow me. He begins to advance slowly towards her.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was it Schevchuk? Did he talk? Rachel stands frozen as he creeps closer. He reaches out hand as if to reassure her, a ghastly attempt at reasonableness.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: I can stop him. I won't tell him anymore. (Almost pleading) Nobody needs to know. As if the spell has broken Rachel makes a sudden dart for the doors. But before she can pass him, Vogel has moved with surprising speed and, almost before Rachel has seen the SCISSORS in his other hand, he has stabbed them into her shoulder. She reels over against the opposite wall, dislodging a GLASS SHELF which shatters into a WASHBASIN behind her.  Vogel goes after her, pinning her against the basin, one hand on her throat, the other hand trying to stab her again. Rachel manages to grab the scissor hand and the tw struggle frantically. The scissors inch closer to her FACE, to her EYE. Her other hand emerges from the basin behind her holding piece of the broken glass shelf, which she whips across Vogel's face. He gives a horrible shriek and lets her go, clutching at his cheek. Rachel collapses gasping to the floor. Moaning, Vogel stumbles to a basin, blood dripping down onto the white porcelain from his slashed face. He suddenly notices Rachel has made it to her knees and i trying to crawl towards the door He walks after her, pulls back her head, gets ready to st the scissors into her throat.

dialogues.speaker: VOGEL
dialogues.text: You Jews never knew how to kill. Only how to die.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: Then he gives a gasp of pain, eyes closed, his whole body doubling with the pain, hands weakly scrabbling at the PIECE OF GLASS Rachel has stabbed into his thigh. He falls, almost on top of Rachel, and she finds herself pressed against his contorted face as he hisses and spits in agony. His hand searches blindly for the dropped scissors. Rachel grapples with him, almost embracing him, apparentl trying to prevent him for reaching it. His searching hand locates the scissors and his eyes open in triumph, staring straight into Rachel's. He raises the scissors above his head. Then he stabs Rachel in the stomach. Rachel jack-knifes, as if she's been punched. Then...nothing. Both lie still. The only sound is Vogel's  242 242 243 243 244 244 rasping breathing. Slowly Vogel gathers himself, drops the scissors, gets on his knees - the victor. He climbs to his feet and begins to limp towards the door

dialogues.speaker: PULLING VOGEL
dialogues.text: .В»..as he walks down the corridor, breathing hard, tryin make it back to his room, back to safety. Suddenly he staggers against the wall. Something's wrong, something in his back. He twists aroun trying to locate the source of the strange sensation. And there it is - the HYPODERMIC NEEDLE Rachel has stuck between his shoulders. He touches it with his fingertips, eyes wide with horror, feeling the rush of lethal chemicals through his blood. H twists again trying to pull the needle free but his legs are already giving way and he collapses to the floor. Moments later he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel manages to turn over, starts to drag herself up... MUSIC begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the music continues we see Yuri putting his coat on. He's evidently finished his fruitless interview with Schevchuk, who is sitting slumped by the window. Yuri turns, about to leave, when he suddenly notices a NOTE up the desk, ADDRESSED TO HIM.  245 245 246 246 247 247 248 248 249 249 Surprised, he picks up the note and begins to read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the first line - "My name is Rachel Singer."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road at the back of the hospital. The music continues as we TRACK with Rachel, staring steadily ahead, walking slowly down the long road, her co pulled around her. In the distance, framed between the arches, her abandoned car. Blood begins to spot the ground behind her.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RACHEL'S P.O.V
dialogues.text: We are in darkness. Then a DOOR opens ahead of us and slides to one side revealing an oval of brilliant white light. Slowly we TRACK FORWARD towards the harsh light.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER RACHEL
dialogues.text: ..walking on towards her car.

dialogues.speaker: FINAL SHOOTING SCRIPT WITH PINK AMENDMENTS
dialogues.text: We're at the top of an AIRPLANE STAIRWAY, which leads dow to the runway below, and two lines of waiting DIGNITARIES applauding.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER RACHEL
dialogues.text: 250 250 251 251 252 252 Walking on - a small lone figure against the white of the snow.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY AIRBASE. ISRAEL
dialogues.text: The three YOUNG PEOPLE begin their descent down the stair towards the WELCOME PARTY.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER RACHEL
dialogues.text: ...tiny, framed within the two arches. Still moving towar the car....

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY AIRBASE. ISRAEL
dialogues.text: We CLOSE on Young Rachel as she blinks against the harsh sunlight, takes out a pair of sunglasses and slips them o Then she steps forward to accept her reward.
